intro: Fagara hieronymi, commonly known as the Jamaican wild pepper, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, red, peppery fruits that are used in local cuisine and traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and ethnobotanical studies. Fagara hieronymi thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
